identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Football/National Football League/New York Jets

abstract.p: Jumbo Elliott re-signs with New York Jets (S)

block.p: Jumbo Elliott went through his first practice with the Jets today since surgery last March.
''I'm pain free,'' said Elliott, who was brought back last weekend after he retired last year.
Elliott, 35, underwent two surgical procedures to alleviate his constant back pain. He went to the Pro Bowl as a Giant and is now backing up his former pupil, Jason Fabini, at left tackle.
Elliott described pain radiating through his body that was so intense that he was unable to start midway through last season.

The Jets had a rocky first half after Vinny Testaverde was injured in the opening game. Elliott was on the bench when Fabini started at New England in the ninth game -- only to tear up his knee. Elliott played the rest of the season.
Jumbo Elliott went through his first practice with the Jets today since surgery last March.
''I'm pain free,'' said Elliott, who was brought back last weekend after he retired last year.
Elliott, 35, underwent two surgical procedures to alleviate his constant back pain. He went to the Pro Bowl as a Giant and is now backing up his former pupil, Jason Fabini, at left tackle.
Elliott described pain radiating through his body that was so intense that he was unable to start midway through last season.

The Jets had a rocky first half after Vinny Testaverde was injured in the opening game. Elliott was on the bench when Fabini started at New England in the ninth game -- only to tear up his knee. Elliott played the rest of the season.

While Elliott is free to practice, his return hinges on an appeal to the league Wednesday of a two-game suspension. A Nassau County court earlier this year fined him $250 and ordered 50 hours of community service for a misdemeanor conviction in a bar fight.
A misdemeanor charge against Fabini was dismissed.
''I'm very optimistic,'' Elliott said of the appeal.
